document.title: K-12 Arts New Hampshire Curriculum Framework

B88B30A0DFE60131715A68A86D17958E.description: describe various kinds of artists and fields of art particular to New Hampshire.

B88ADF60DFE60131715968A86D17958E.description: identify a variety of professions in the visual arts;

B88A9590DFE60131715868A86D17958E.description: Understand the range of careers in the field of visual arts and identify careers associated with this field.

B88A4B70DFE60131715768A86D17958E.description: describe how the visual art design principles are expressed in multi-media presentations and daily life.

B88A0130DFE60131715668A86D17958E.description: describe how the visual arts are used in the world around us and how they are part of our everyday life;

B889B4B0DFE60131715568A86D17958E.description: understand that similarities exist between the visual arts and other disciplines;

B8896640DFE60131715468A86D17958E.description: identify connections among the visual arts and other arts disciplines;

B88911D0DFE60131715368A86D17958E.description: Students will make connections among the visual arts, other disciplines, and daily life.

B888C980DFE60131715268A86D17958E.description: identify possible improvements in the process of creating their own work.

B88879A0DFE60131715168A86D17958E.description: describe their personal responses to specific works of art using visual art terminology;

B8882970DFE60131715068A86D17958E.description: understand that people may respond in different and equally valid ways to specific art works;

B887D750DFE60131714F68A86D17958E.description: describe how people's experiences influence the development of specific art works;

B88785C0DFE60131714E68A86D17958E.description: identify various purposes for creating works of art;

B8810E00DFE60131714D68A86D17958E.description: Analyze, interpret and evaluate their own and others' artwork.

B880B9E0DFE60131714C68A86D17958E.description: create a work of art that reflects an understanding of how history or culture can influence visual art.

B8806280DFE60131714B68A86D17958E.description: identify a variety of art objects, artists, and resources specific to New Hampshire;

B8801130DFE60131714A68A86D17958E.description: describe how history, culture, and visual arts influence each other;

B87FC960DFE60131714968A86D17958E.description: identify specific works of art in particular cultures, times, and places;

B87F8460DFE60131714868A86D17958E.description: know that the visual arts have both a history and a specific relationship to various cultures;

B87F3D30DFE60131714768A86D17958E.description: Analyze the visual arts in relation to history and culture.

B87EEF70DFE60131714668A86D17958E.description: create art, selecting and using appropriate subject matter, symbols, and ideas to communicate meaning.

B87E8FF0DFE60131714568A86D17958E.description: explore and understand prospective content for works of art;

B87E44B0DFE60131714468A86D17958E.description: Select and apply a range of subject matter, symbols and ideas.

B87DFAD0DFE60131714368A86D17958E.description: create works of art that use the elements of art and principles of design to communicate and express ideas.

B87DADE0DFE60131714268A86D17958E.description: describe how different expressive features, and ways of organizing them, cause different responses;

B87D5FB0DFE60131714168A86D17958E.description: describe the principles of design including balance, unity and rhythm;

B87D0C70DFE60131714068A86D17958E.description: recognize the visual elements including color, shape, form, space, line, value, and texture;

B87CB340DFE60131713F68A86D17958E.description: Identify and apply the elements of visual art and principles of design.

B87C26F0DFE60131713D68A86D17958E.description: use art materials and tools in a safe and responsible manner;

B87BDDD0DFE60131713C68A86D17958E.description: use various materials, techniques, and processes to communicate and express ideas, experiences, and stories;

B87B88D0DFE60131713B68A86D17958E.description: describe how different techniques, media, and processes produce different effects and personal responses;

B87B33E0DFE60131713A68A86D17958E.description: differentiate between materials, techniques, and processes of making art;

B87AC500DFE60131713968A86D17958E.description: Apply appropriate media, techniques, and processes.

B87A1E90DFE60131713768A86D17958E.description: identify New Hampshire theatre resources (play groups, theatres, playhouses).

B879D3A0DFE60131713668A86D17958E.description: describe a variety of professions in the field of theatre and identify careers that are associated with theatre;

B87985E0DFE60131713568A86D17958E.description: discuss how creating theatre takes the efforts of many people with many different skills;

B87937E0DFE60131713468A86D17958E.description: Understand the range of careers in the field of theatre arts and identify careers associated with this field.

B878DFE0DFE60131713368A86D17958E.description: articulate the ways in which participation in theatre arts enhances daily lives.

B87898F0DFE60131713268A86D17958E.description: identify and compare the various settings and reasons for creating drama and attending theatre, film, television, and electronic media productions;

B8785020DFE60131713168A86D17958E.description: identify and compare similar characters and situations in stories and dramas from and about various cultures, illustrate with classroom dramatizations, and discuss how theatre reflects life;

B8780680DFE60131713068A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of context by analyzing and comparing theatre in various cultures, historical periods and everyday life.

B877B970DFE60131712F68A86D17958E.description: analyze classroom dramatizations and, using appropriate terminology, constructively suggest alternative ideas for dramatizing roles, arranging environments, and developing situations; also suggest means of improving the collaborative processes of planning, playing, responding, and evaluating;

B8776B10DFE60131712E68A86D17958E.description: articulate emotional responses to and explain personal preferences about the whole as well as the parts of dramatic performances;

B8771B10DFE60131712D68A86D17958E.description: explain how the wants and needs of characters are similar to, and different than, their own;

B876CD00DFE60131712C68A86D17958E.description: identify and describe the visual, aural, oral, and kinetic elements of classroom dramatizations and dramatic performances;

B8767900DFE60131712B68A86D17958E.description: Students will analyze, critique and construct meanings from works of theatre.

B8762410DFE60131712A68A86D17958E.description: identify connections between theatre and other disciplines in the curriculum.

B875CF90DFE60131712968A86D17958E.description: select movement, music, or visual elements to enhance the mood of a classroom dramatization;

B8757050DFE60131712868A86D17958E.description: compare how ideas and emotions are expressed in theatre, dramatic media, dance, music, and visual arts;

B8751F80DFE60131712768A86D17958E.description: describe visual, aural, oral, and kinetic ( involving movement) elements in theatre, dramatic media, dance, music, and visual arts;

B874CC80DFE60131712668A86D17958E.description: Students will make curriculum connections among theatre, the arts, and other disciplines.

B8748120DFE60131712568A86D17958E.description: communicate information to peers about people, events, time, and place related to classroom dramatizations.

B8743760DFE60131712468A86D17958E.description: Students will research, evaluate and apply cultural and historical information to make artistic choices.

B873E880DFE60131712368A86D17958E.description: demonstrate various ways of staging classroom dramatizations such as using storytelling, video cameras, or movement

B8734B20DFE60131712168A86D17958E.description: Students will direct by planning or interpreting works of theatre by organizing and conducting rehearsals.

B872FF70DFE60131712068A86D17958E.description: organize available materials that suggest scenery, properties, lighting, sound, costumes, and makeup in a collaborative group .

B872B590DFE60131711F68A86D17958E.description: visualize environments and construct designs to communicate locale and mood;

B8726A40DFE60131711E68A86D17958E.description: Students will design and produce the technical elements of theatre through artistic interpretation and execution.

B8721C30DFE60131711D68A86D17958E.description: assume roles in classroom dramatizations based on personal experience and heritage, imagination, literature, and history.

B871C750DFE60131711C68A86D17958E.description: use variations of locomotor and nonlocomotor movement and vocal pitch, tempo, and tone for different characters;

B8716E90DFE60131711B68A86D17958E.description: imagine and clearly describe characters, their relationships, and their environments;

B8711600DFE60131711A68A86D17958E.description: Students will act by developing, improvising, communicating and sustaining characters.

B870A670DFE60131711968A86D17958E.description: improvise dialogue to tell stories, then formalize their improvisations by writing or recording the dialogue.

B87057D0DFE60131711868A86D17958E.description: collaborate to select interrelated characters, environments, and situations for classroom dramatizations;

B86FFC20DFE60131711768A86D17958E.description: Students will create theatre through improvising, writing and refining scripts.

B8612340DFE6013170E768A86D17958E.description: recognize that people evaluate music and music performances.

B860DAD0DFE6013170E668A86D17958E.description: identify professions where skills of arranging and composing music are used;

B8609480DFE6013170E568A86D17958E.description: identify local resources where people can take part in singing;

B8604D30DFE6013170E468A86D17958E.description: identify occupations in which people sing or play musical instruments ;

B8600400DFE6013170E368A86D17958E.description: Identify the range of careers in the field of music

B86F5D40DFE60131711568A86D17958E.description: describe the way music has been a continuous part of the history of human culture.

B86F0FD0DFE60131711468A86D17958E.description: demonstrate audience behavior appropriate for the context and style of music performed;

B86EC5B0DFE60131711368A86D17958E.description: identify and describe the roles of musicians in music settings and cultures;

B86E7A20DFE60131711268A86D17958E.description: identify many uses of music in their daily experiences and describe characteristics that make certain music suitable for each use;

B86E2290DFE60131711168A86D17958E.description: describe in simple terms how elements of music are used in various world cultures;

B86DD400DFE60131711068A86D17958E.description: identify by genre or style aural examples of music from various historical periods and cultures;

B86D7BE0DFE60131710F68A86D17958E.description: Understand music in relation to history and culture.

B86D3240DFE60131710E68A86D17958E.description: identify ways in which the principles and subject matter of other disciplines are related to those of music.

B86CE640DFE60131710D68A86D17958E.description: identify similarities and differences in the meanings of common terms used in the various arts;

B86C9580DFE60131710C68A86D17958E.description: Understand relationships among music, the other arts, and disciplines outside the arts.

B86C33D0DFE60131710B68A86D17958E.description: explain, using appropriate music terminology, personal preferences for specific musical works and styles.

B86BDDD0DFE60131710A68A86D17958E.description: devise criteria for evaluating performances and compositions;

B86B4540DFE60131710868A86D17958E.description: respond through purposeful movement to selected prominent features in a piece of music.

B86AF9D0DFE60131710768A86D17958E.description: identify the sounds of different instruments, including many orchestra and band instruments, and instruments from various cultures, as well as children's voices and male and female adult voices;

B86AAB40DFE60131710668A86D17958E.description: use appropriate terminology in explaining music, music notation, music instruments and voices, and music performances;

B86A59C0DFE60131710568A86D17958E.description: demonstrate perceptual skills by moving to, inquiring about, and describing aural examples of music from various styles representing diverse cultures;

B86A10C0DFE60131710468A86D17958E.description: identify simple music forms when presented aurally;

B869BEA0DFE60131710368A86D17958E.description: Listen to, analyze, and describe music.

B8696DE0DFE60131710268A86D17958E.description: use standard symbols to notate meter, rhythm, pitch, and dynamics in simple patterns presented by the teacher.

B86923E0DFE60131710168A86D17958E.description: identify symbols and traditional terms referring to dynamics, tempo, and articulation and interpret them correctly when performing;

B868D9F0DFE60131710068A86D17958E.description: use a system (that is, syllables, numbers, or letters) to read simple pitch notation in the treble clef in major keys;

B86880C0DFE6013170FF68A86D17958E.description: read whole, half, dotted half, quarter, and eighth notes and rests in 2/4, 3/4, and 4/4 meter signatures;

B867EEB0DFE6013170FD68A86D17958E.description: use a variety of sound sources when composing.

B8679B80DFE6013170FC68A86D17958E.description: create and arrange short songs and instrumental pieces within specified guidelines;

B86745C0DFE6013170FB68A86D17958E.description: create and arrange music to accompany readings or dramatizations;

B866EF40DFE6013170FA68A86D17958E.description: Compose and arrange music within specified guidelines.

B8668590DFE6013170F968A86D17958E.description: improvise short songs and instrumental pieces, using a variety of sound sources, including traditional sounds, nontraditional sounds available in the classroom, body sounds, and sounds produced by electronic means.

B8662FA0DFE6013170F868A86D17958E.description: improvise simple rhythmic variations and simple melodic embellishments on familiar melodies;

B865E350DFE6013170F768A86D17958E.description: improvise simple rhythmic and melodic ostinato accompaniments;

B8659CB0DFE6013170F668A86D17958E.description: improvise "answers" in the same style to given rhythmic and melodic phrases;

B8650760DFE6013170F468A86D17958E.description: perform independent instrumental parts while other students sing or play contrasting parts.

B864B450DFE6013170F368A86D17958E.description: perform in groups, blending instrumental timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor;

B8646990DFE6013170F268A86D17958E.description: echo short rhythms and melodic patterns;

B86419D0DFE6013170F168A86D17958E.description: perform expressively a varied repertoire of music representing diverse genres and styles;

B863CCE0DFE6013170F068A86D17958E.description: perform easy rhythmic, melodic, and chordal patterns accurately and independently on rhythmic, melodic, and harmonic classroom instruments;

B86384C0DFE6013170EF68A86D17958E.description: perform on pitch, in rhythm, with appropriate dynamics and timbre, and maintain a steady tempo;

B8633B70DFE6013170EE68A86D17958E.description: Perform on instruments, alone and with others, a varied repertoire of music.

B862EA00DFE6013170ED68A86D17958E.description: sing in groups, blending vocal timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor.

B862A080DFE6013170EC68A86D17958E.description: sing ostinatos, partner songs, and rounds;

B86254B0DFE6013170EB68A86D17958E.description: sing from memory a varied repertoire of songs representing genres and styles from diverse cultures;

B8620A70DFE6013170EA68A86D17958E.description: sing expressively, with appropriate dynamics, phrasing, and interpretation;

B861C280DFE6013170E968A86D17958E.description: sing independently, on pitch and in rhythm, with appropriate timbre, diction, and posture, and maintain a steady tempo;

B86176C0DFE6013170E868A86D17958E.description: Sing, alone and with others, a varied repertoire of music.

B85F51E0DFE6013170E168A86D17958E.description: analyze how creating dance events takes the efforts of people with many different skills.

B85EFC20DFE6013170E068A86D17958E.description: describe the ways in which participation in dance enhances everyday life;

B85EAC70DFE6013170DF68A86D17958E.description: Identify the range of careers in the field of dance.

B85E4B10DFE6013170DE68A86D17958E.description: respond to a dance using another arts discipline.

B85DFBB0DFE6013170DD68A86D17958E.description: create a dance project that reveals understanding of a concept or idea from another discipline, such as pattern in dance and science;

B85DA450DFE6013170DC68A86D17958E.description: Make connections between dance and other disciplines.

B85D5B80DFE6013170DB68A86D17958E.description: explain how healthy practices, such as nutrition and safety, enhance their ability to dance.

B85D1260DFE6013170DA68A86D17958E.description: identify personal wellness goals and how aspects of dance can be used to meet those goals;

B85CC8A0DFE6013170D968A86D17958E.description: Make connections between dance and healthful living.

B85C7BA0DFE6013170D868A86D17958E.description: identify ways that dance has been a continuous part of the history of human culture.

B85C26F0DFE6013170D768A86D17958E.description: examine dance from a particular culture and time period;

B85BCF60DFE6013170D668A86D17958E.description: learn and share a dance from a resource in their own community; describe the cultural and/or historical context;

B85B89D0DFE6013170D568A86D17958E.description: perform folk dances from various cultures and communities within New Hampshire;

B85B4190DFE6013170D468A86D17958E.description: Recognize and demonstrate dance in various cultures and historical periods.

B85AF6B0DFE6013170D368A86D17958E.description: observe two dances and discuss how they are similar and different in terms of the basic components used to create a dance.

B85AA140DFE6013170D268A86D17958E.description: explore multiple solutions to a given movement problem; choose their favorite solution and analyze the reasons for that choice;

B85A4490DFE6013170D168A86D17958E.description: Apply and demonstrate critical and creative thinking skills in dance.

B859E580DFE6013170D068A86D17958E.description: present their own dances to peers and discuss their meanings.

B8599C80DFE6013170CF68A86D17958E.description: discuss interpretations of and reactions to a dance;

B8595190DFE6013170CE68A86D17958E.description: observe and discuss how dance is different than other forms of human movement;

B858FF60DFE6013170CD68A86D17958E.description: Recognize dance as a way to create and communicate meaning.

B8588100DFE6013170CC68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate the following partner skills: copying, mirroring, leading and following.

B8582A60DFE6013170CB68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate the ability to work effectively alone and with a partner or in a small group;

B857DF00DFE6013170CA68A86D17958E.description: create a dance phrase, accurately repeat it, and then vary it;

B85792B0DFE6013170C968A86D17958E.description: use improvisation to discover and invent movement and to solve movement problems;

B8574210DFE6013170C868A86D17958E.description: improvise, create and perform movements based on their own ideas and ideas from other sources;

B856ED20DFE6013170C768A86D17958E.description: create a sequence with a beginning, middle, and end, both with and without a rhythmic accompaniment and identify each part of the sequence;

B8564690DFE6013170C568A86D17958E.description: observe and describe the action and movement elements of space, time, and energy, in a brief movement study.

B855FB10DFE6013170C468A86D17958E.description: demonstrate concentration, focus and kinesthetic awareness (a sense of movement internalized by the muscles), in performing movement skills;

B855ACB0DFE6013170C368A86D17958E.description: demonstrate accuracy in moving to a musical beat and responding to changes in tempo;

B8555520DFE6013170C268A86D17958E.description: demonstrate movements in straight and curved pathways;

B854F730DFE6013170C168A86D17958E.description: demonstrate the ability to define and maintain personal space;

B8549AB0DFE6013170C068A86D17958E.description: create shapes at low, middle, and high levels;

B85444F0DFE6013170BF68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate the eight basic locomotor movements of walk, run, hop, jump, leap, skip, gallop, slide, while moving forward, backward, sideward, diagonally and turning;

B853A2D0DFE6013170BD68A86D17958E.description: Identify and demonstrate movement elements and skills in performing dance.
